decks.notes: This mono black control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing discard effects like Raven's Crime and Wrench Mind to keep their hand empty. The deck is able to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Bontu's Last Reckoning, and win the game through incremental damage with cards like The Rack and Shrieking Affliction. The deck uses Liliana of the Veil as a powerful planeswalker and Smallpox as a way to further disrupt the opponent's resources. It aims to grind out a win through attrition and resource denial.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence with artifact creatures and pump spells to deal massive damage to the opponent as fast as possible. Key cards like Cranial Plating, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager help to boost the power of the creatures and make them difficult to deal with. The combination of efficient creatures like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest along with powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum allows the deck to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This Modern Aggro deck focuses on fast, direct damage to the opponent with low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm. The key strategy is to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while maintaining aggression with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Eidolon of the Great Revel, and Goblin Guide. The deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their game plan, making use of efficient removal like Searing Blaze and Skullcrack to maintain tempo and pressure.

The deck focuses on utilizing creature abilities to assemble a powerful combo that effectively controls the board and generates value. By tutoring for specific creatures with Chord of Calling and Collected Company, the deck can quickly assemble the key pieces necessary to win the game. The creatures chosen for the toolbox provide a versatile range of options for any situation, allowing for adaptability and resilience against various strategies. The deck aims to create a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a well-coordinated combo.

This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by using cards like Death's Shadow and Tarmogoyf, which benefit from losing life quickly. The deck also includes disruption tools such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand, while removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald provide card selection and help to find key cards in the deck. Overall, the deck aims to win the game as efficiently as possible through early aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total to boost the power of Death's Shadow, a central card that grows stronger as your life decreases. This aggressive strategy is supported by disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and card advantage, while Liliana of the Veil offers disruption and removal. The deck aims to quickly close out the game by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and efficient spells.

The focus of this deck is to quickly reduce your own life total to capitalize on the power of Death's Shadow, a creature that grows stronger the lower your life total. The deck includes spells like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Stubborn Denial to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler, the deck aims to apply pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to recover. The deck is fast-paced and aggressive, aiming to win the game as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to play big threats like Primeval Titan and Craterhoof Behemoth early in the game. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Garruk Wildspeaker and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to create additional threats and provide support. With a mix of strong creatures, removal spells, and mana acceleration, this Mono Green Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient and aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping into Eldrazi threats using lands like Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine. It aims to disrupt opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while applying pressure with powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Endbringer. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and All Is Dust to handle threats on the opponent's side of the board. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast mana and big threats while controlling the game with disruption and removal.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize mana-generating elves and cards that synergize with elves to quickly build up a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combo finish. By utilizing cards like Heritage Druid, Elvish Archdruid, and Ezuri, Renegade Leader, the deck can generate a large amount of mana and pump up its creatures for a lethal attack. Cards like Shaman of the Pack and Collected Company provide additional ways to deal damage, while cards like Lead the Stampede and Chord of Calling help maintain card advantage and find key combo pieces.

The deck focuses on building a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures that benefit from each other's abilities. By playing multiple creatures in the early game and leveraging cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of Aether Vial helps to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, while disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage can disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's mana base is built to support its multi-colored creatures, ensuring consistent and fast aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through card draw and card selection. The deck aims to control the board through powerful instant-speed removal spells like Path to Exile, Lightning Bolt, and Lightning Helix, while also utilizing counter spells like Cryptic Command and Logic Knot to stop opponent's threats. The deck also has card advantage engines like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage to out value opponents in the long game. Additionally, the deck can win through Celestial Colonnade beatdown or a Secure the Wastes token army.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while removing threats with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Terminate. The deck also utilizes cards like Faithless Looting and Bedlam Reveler to refill the hand and generate card advantage. Additionally, Lingering Souls and Young Pyromancer provide multiple threats that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck can also grind out games with cards like Kolaghan's Command and Liliana of the Veil. Overall, it's a versatile and aggressive deck that aims to disrupt and apply pressure.

The deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Merfolk creatures, boosting them with Lords of Atlantis and Master of Waves. It aims to disrupt opponents with tempo plays like bouncing creatures with Harbinger of the Tides and countering spells with Cursecatcher. The deck also includes utility lands and disrupting cards like Spreading Seas to control the game and ensure that the Merfolk can overwhelm the opponent with their tribal synergy and powerful abilities.

This Modern deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Dreadbore. The deck also utilizes Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to generate card advantage and control the board. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponents who rely heavily on non-basic lands. The deck also has aggressive threats in Pack Rat and Goblin Rabblemaster to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly rush and overwhelm the opponent with cheap, aggressive creatures and burn spells. By consistently dealing damage to the opponent's life total and preventing them from stabilizing, the deck aims to win within the first few turns of the game. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells such as Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, to maintain pressure and close out the game swiftly before the opponent has a chance to recover.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through the UrzaTron lands and using powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to control the game. It also includes key cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to search for lands and maintain card advantage, while Relic of Progenitus provides graveyard hate. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with board wipes like Oblivion Stone and removal spells like Ancient Grudge, ultimately overwhelming them with its powerful threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells, while also maintaining control of the battlefield with efficient creatures like Kitchen Finks and Restoration Angel. It aims to outvalue the opponent with card advantage and incremental advantage over time, winning the game through attrition and a powerful late game threat in Celestial Colonnade. The key idea is to stall the game out, controlling the pace of the match until you can establish a dominant position and close out the game.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle with Scapeshift to deal lethal damage to the opponent. It utilizes ramp spells like Explore and Search for Tomorrow to accelerate mana production, while Primeval Titan can quickly tutor for Valakut and trigger its ability. Prismatic Omen ensures that all lands count as Mountains, increasing the effectiveness of Scapeshift. The deck also includes removal and card draw spells like Lightning Bolt and Courser of Kruphix to control the game and dig for combo pieces.
